Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown to communicate errors to the client when the client connects to non-.NET Framework applications that cannot throw exceptions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ServerException> uses the HRESULT COR_E_SERVER, which has the value 0x8013150E.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ServerException> uses the default <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> implementation, which supports reference equality.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ServerException>, see the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ServerException> constructors.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
